snippet: A new District of Columbia marijuana law elicited stern warnings from the local police but good cheer from many Washingtonians.
abstract: One of nation's least restrictive marijuana laws goes into effect in District of Columbia, eliciting stern warnings from local police but good cheer from Washington residents; law reduces penalty for having up to an ounce of marijuana to civil infraction that carries $25 fine.
lead_paragraph: A new District of Columbia marijuana law elicited stern warnings from the local police but good cheer from many Washingtonians.

headline.main: $25 Penalties for Marijuana Go Into Effect in the Capital
headline.print_headline: $25 Penalties for Marijuana Go Into Effect in the Capital
